'''Charles William "Charlie" Dunnett''' (24 August 1921 â€“ May 18, 2007) was a [[Canadian]] statistician.  He was the [[Statistical Society of Canada]] 1986 Gold Medalist and [[Professor Emeritus]] of the Departments of [[Mathematics]], [[Statistics]], [[Clinical Epidemiology]], and [[Biostatistics]] of [[McMaster University]].

Two of his papers<ref>Dunnett C. W. (1955.) "A multiple comparison procedure for comparing several treatments with a control", ''Journal of the American Statistical Association'', '''50''':1096{{Ndash}}1121.</ref><ref>Dunnett C. W. (1964.) "New tables for multiple comparisons with a control", ''Biometrics'', '''20''':482{{Ndash}}491.</ref> are listed among the top 25 most-cited papers in statistics (numbers 14 and 21 in the list).<ref>[http://www.biostat.jhsph.edu/~yonchen/most.cited.stat.papers.pdf The most cited statistical papers]</ref>

Dunnett died on 18 May 2007 from lymphoma.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://fhs.mcmaster.ca/main/documents/deans_newsletter_2007_fall.pdf|title=Dean's Newsletter|publisher= McMaster University Health Sciences|date=Fall 2007|page=3}}</ref>
